result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherry Shandaw Murry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sherry Shandaw Murry appeared by video.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Sherry Shandaw Murry.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has not received an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. 
Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Sherry Shandaw Murry in court. Student Intern Lukas Jaeger under the supervision of Attorney  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20,right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/22/22 @ 2:30p
